qas.question: When did John begin his final campaign to reclaim Normandy?
Who did John build alliances with?

answers.text: Emperor Otto, Renaud of Boulogne and Count Ferdinand of Flanders

qas.question: When did John leave for Poitou?

context: In <a0_0>1214<a0_0/> John began his final campaign to reclaim Normandy from Philip. John was optimistic, as he had successfully built up alliances with the <a1_0>Emperor Otto, Renaud of Boulogne and Count Ferdinand of Flanders<a1_0/>; he was enjoying papal favour; and he had successfully built up substantial funds to pay for the deployment of his experienced army. Nonetheless, when John left for Poitou in <a2_0>February 1214<a2_0/>, many barons refused to provide military service; mercenary knights had to fill the gaps. John's plan was to split Philip's forces by pushing north-east from Poitou towards Paris, whilst Otto, Renaud and Ferdinand, supported by William Longespée, marched south-west from Flanders.
